page.title: 03BURRELL COLLECTION GLASGOW
page.content: At the early age of 7 Wm Burrell became really interested in all forms of art; and by the age of l5 he had begun his own art collection. All through his life Wm. collected all forms of art and when he died in l958 he gave his art collection to the people of Glasgow. For years arguments raged about finding a suitable site for the collection. Eventually it was decided that a museum would be built in Pollok Park for all his treasures which have been valued at Â£lOOm. A competition was held for the design of the museum and was won by a Glasgwegian architect Mr Gasson. The Queen opened the Museum on 2lst Oct. l983 and in l985 it was named UK Museum of the Year and had overtaken Edinburgh Castle as Scotland's leading tourist attraction. Glasgow is proud of the collection.
